snippet: While the stores are not expected to have a large impact on the company’s market share in India, some analysts say the change could help Apple attract the top tier of India’s smartphone buyers.
abstract: Apple appears likely to open its first retail stores in India soon; move comes in wake of intense lobbying effort to loosen rules requiring 30 percent of products sold in stores come from India; stores are not expected to drastically increase Apple's market share, but may help attract top tier of smartphone consumers.

byline.contributor: Ayesha Venkataraman contributed reporting from Mumbai and Paul Mozur from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: While the stores are not expected to have a large impact on the company’s market share in India, some analysts say the change could help Apple attract the top tier of India’s smartphone buyers.

headline.main: Apple May Soon Open Retail Stores in India
headline.print_headline: Apple May Soon Open Retail Stores in India
